summary: This is the July 2019 federal indictment of Jeffrey Epstein, filed in the Southern District of New York. It charges Epstein with one count of sex trafficking conspiracy and one count of sex trafficking of minors, detailing a scheme from 2002-2005 where he sexually abused dozens of minor girls at his residences in New York and Florida, paying them cash and using victim-recruiters to expand his network. The indictment also includes forfeiture allegations targeting his New York mansion.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein is charged with sex trafficking conspiracy and sex trafficking of minors for abusing dozens of girls as young as 14 from at least 2002 to 2005.
Epstein used a network of employees (Employee-1, Employee-2, Employee-3) to schedule sexual encounters with minor victims at his New York and Florida residences.
Epstein paid victims hundreds of dollars in cash per encounter and incentivized them to recruit other minor girls, creating a self-sustaining victim pipeline.
The indictment specifies that Epstein knew victims were underage, as some (like Minor Victim-1 and Minor Victim-3) told him their age directly.
The U.S. seeks forfeiture of Epstein's New York mansion at 9 East 71st Street, owned by Maple, Inc., as property used to facilitate the crimes.
